page.title: 01PORKELLIS Cornwall Geography
page.content: PORKELLIS, a typical small Cornish farming village lies 5Km north of Helston and 6Km south of Redruth. The area itself comprises rough moorland with fairly steep valleys, cultivated where possible for rough grazing and a little arable farming. To the {north east}lies Stithians reservoir, an area of water covering some two square Km and an important source of water for the Camborne and Redruth areas. This is fed by numerous streams from the surrounding high ground. The {north west}of the area is the least cultivated, dominated by the moorlands of Carnmenellis and White Alice. The { {south}of the area has the richest soil, and the most cultivated arable land lies between PORKELLIS and Carnkie.
